intro: Senecio neuquensis, commonly known as the Neuquén groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Patagonian region of Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its foliage is usually gray-green, with hairy surfaces that help reduce water loss. Senecio neuquensis is often found in mountainous areas, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
